intro: Pigafetta malabarica, commonly known as the Malabar pigafetta, is a flowering plant native to the western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and opposite, ovate leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in dense forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
